notes: This file is designed to be parsed twice: (1) LLM enrichment (add explanation/usage/examples/media), then (2) DB import.
Points are intentionally granular enough for credit assignment (e.g., accusative split by pattern).
A few patterns (e.g., dative 'мне нравится', надо/нужно) are included as chunk-first A1 content; mark them comprehension-first if desired.

tags.description: Dative case (A1: only in a few chunks, e.g., мне нравится).

tags.name: meta:comprehension-first

grammar_points.title: Neutral word order (SVO) as default
grammar_points.summary: Use Subject–Verb–Object as a safe default for simple statements.

grammar_points.title: No 'to be' in present (нулевая связка)
grammar_points.summary: In present tense, Russian often omits 'to be': 'Он студент.'
grammar_points.usage_notes: In writing you may see a dash; in speech it's usually a pause.

grammar_points.title: Это + noun (identification)
grammar_points.summary: Use 'Это' to identify: 'Это книга.'

grammar_points.title: А vs Но (contrast)
grammar_points.summary: Use 'а' for mild contrast/topic shift; 'но' for stronger opposition.

examples.translation_text: I'm a student, and he's a teacher.
There is coffee, but no tea.

examples.example_text: Я хочу чай, но нет сахара.
examples.translation_text: I want tea, but there is no sugar.

grammar_points.title: Yes/No questions with intonation
grammar_points.summary: Form many yes/no questions by intonation, without changing word order.

grammar_points.title: Кто? (Who?)
grammar_points.summary: Ask about people.

grammar_points.title: Что? (What?)
grammar_points.summary: Ask about things/actions.

grammar_points.title: Где? (Where: location)
grammar_points.summary: Ask where something is (static).

grammar_points.title: Куда? (Where to)
grammar_points.summary: Ask about destination.

grammar_points.title: Откуда? (Where from)
grammar_points.summary: Ask about origin.

grammar_points.title: Когда? (When?)
grammar_points.summary: Ask about time.

grammar_points.title: Почему? (Why?)
grammar_points.summary: Ask for a reason.

grammar_points.title: Как? (How?)
grammar_points.summary: Ask about manner/state.

grammar_points.title: Какой/какая/какое/какие?
grammar_points.summary: Ask 'which/what kind' with agreement.

examples.translation_text: What kind of movie is this?
What kind of book is this?

grammar_points.title: Сколько? (How many/much?)
grammar_points.summary: Ask quantity.

grammar_points.title: ИЛИ (or) for choice questions
grammar_points.summary: Use 'или' to offer simple alternatives.

examples.translation_text: Are you at home or at work?

grammar_points.title: не + verb
grammar_points.summary: Negate verbs with 'не' placed before the verb.

grammar_points.title: не + noun/adjective predicate
grammar_points.summary: Negate identity/quality: 'Он не студент.'

grammar_points.title: Нет (no / there isn't / I don't have)
grammar_points.summary: Use 'нет' as a short 'no' and as absence marker (with genitive).

grammar_points.title: Gender recognition: masculine
grammar_points.summary: Recognize masculine nouns (often consonant/-й endings) for agreement.

grammar_points.title: Gender recognition: feminine
grammar_points.summary: Recognize feminine nouns (-а/-я, many -ь) for agreement.

grammar_points.title: Gender recognition: neuter
grammar_points.summary: Recognize neuter nouns (-о/-е) for agreement.

grammar_points.title: Animacy awareness (affects accusative)
grammar_points.summary: Know that animacy changes accusative for masculine nouns (A1 essential).

grammar_points.title: Plural formation: -ы/-и (basic)
grammar_points.summary: Form many plurals with -ы/-и; know spelling-rule effects at a practical level.

grammar_points.title: Plural formation: neuter -о/-е → -а/-я
grammar_points.summary: Common neuter plural pattern: окно→окна, море→моря.

grammar_points.title: High-frequency irregular plurals (core set)
grammar_points.summary: Recognize and use a small core of irregular plurals early.
grammar_points.usage_notes: Production may be limited; comprehension is essential.

grammar_points.title: Nominative: subject
grammar_points.summary: Use nominative for subjects.

examples.translation_text: The book is on the table.

grammar_points.title: Nominative: identification (X is Y)
grammar_points.summary: Identity statements use nominative nouns: 'Он студент.'

grammar_points.title: Accusative: inanimate direct object (often = nominative)
grammar_points.summary: Many inanimate nouns have accusative = nominative.

grammar_points.title: Accusative: feminine -а → -у
grammar_points.summary: Feminine -а nouns change to -у in accusative.

grammar_points.title: Accusative: feminine -я → -ю
grammar_points.summary: Feminine -я nouns change to -ю in accusative.

grammar_points.title: Accusative: masculine animate (often = genitive)
grammar_points.summary: Masculine animate accusative often matches genitive: 'вижу брата'.

grammar_points.title: Prepositional: в + location (где?)
grammar_points.summary: Use 'в' + prepositional to say where (in/at).

examples.translation_text: The book is in the bag.

grammar_points.title: Prepositional: на + location (где?)
grammar_points.summary: Use 'на' + prepositional for certain places/surfaces.

examples.translation_text: The phone is on the table.

grammar_points.title: Genitive: у + possession frame
grammar_points.summary: Use 'у + genitive' to express having: 'У меня есть ...'.

grammar_points.title: Genitive: нет + genitive (absence)
grammar_points.summary: Use 'нет' + genitive to express absence: 'У меня нет ...'.

grammar_points.title: Genitive: из + origin (from inside)
grammar_points.summary: Use 'из' + genitive for 'from' (inside a place).

grammar_points.title: Genitive: с + origin (from surface/event)
grammar_points.summary: Use 'с' + genitive for 'from' (surface/event).

examples.translation_text: Take the book from the table.

grammar_points.title: Dative chunk: мне/тебе нравится ...
grammar_points.summary: Express liking via 'нравится' with dative experiencer (A1 chunk).
grammar_points.usage_notes: Treat as a ready-made pattern at A1; deeper dative uses can wait.

grammar_points.title: Personal pronouns (nominative)
grammar_points.summary: я, ты, он, она, оно, мы, вы, они as subjects.

grammar_points.title: Ты vs Вы (politeness)
grammar_points.summary: Informal 'ты' vs polite/plural 'Вы'.

grammar_points.title: Core object pronoun forms (меня/тебя/его/её/нас/вас/их)
grammar_points.summary: Use common object forms for 'me/you/him/her/us/you/them' (A1 core).

grammar_points.title: Possessives: мой/твой/наш/ваш (agree like adjectives)
grammar_points.summary: Variable possessives agree with noun gender/number (nominative at A1).

grammar_points.title: Possessives: его/её/их (invariable)
grammar_points.summary: его/её/их do not change for gender/number.

grammar_points.title: Demonstratives: этот/эта/это/эти
grammar_points.summary: Use 'this/these' with agreement (nominative at A1).

grammar_points.title: Adjectives: nominative gender agreement
grammar_points.summary: Basic adjective endings agree with gender: -ый/-ая/-ое (simplified).

grammar_points.title: Adjectives: plural agreement (-ые/-ие)
grammar_points.summary: Plural adjectives commonly use -ые/-ие.

grammar_points.title: Adjectives: feminine accusative (-ая→-ую)
grammar_points.summary: Feminine accusative adjective often changes: новая→новую.

grammar_points.title: Infinitive as base form
grammar_points.summary: Use the infinitive as dictionary form and after helper verbs (хочу, могу, буду).

grammar_points.title: Present tense: 1st conjugation (simplified)
grammar_points.summary: High-frequency pattern: -ю, -ешь, -ет, -ем, -ете, -ют.

grammar_points.title: Present tense: 2nd conjugation (simplified)
grammar_points.summary: High-frequency pattern: -ю, -ишь, -ит, -им, -ите, -ят.

grammar_points.title: Reflexive -ся/-сь (high-frequency set)
grammar_points.summary: Recognize and use common reflexive verbs with -ся/-сь.
grammar_points.usage_notes: Keep to a short list at A1; expand later.

grammar_points.title: Past tense: -л/-ла/-ло/-ли
grammar_points.summary: Form past tense with -л and agree by gender/number.

grammar_points.title: Быть (to be): past forms был/была/было/были
grammar_points.summary: Use был/была/было/были to say 'was/were'.

grammar_points.title: Future: буду/будешь/... + infinitive
grammar_points.summary: Use 'буду' + infinitive for basic future plans.

examples.translation_text: Will you read in the evening?

grammar_points.title: Хотеть + infinitive
grammar_points.summary: Express wants/intentions with хотеть + infinitive.

examples.translation_text: We want to go to the park.

grammar_points.title: Мочь + infinitive
grammar_points.summary: Express ability/permission with мочь + infinitive (basic).

grammar_points.title: Надо / Нужно + infinitive (need/must)
grammar_points.summary: Express necessity with надо/нужно + infinitive (A1 chunks).
grammar_points.usage_notes: Often appears with dative experiencer (мне/тебе). Treat as a pattern.

examples.translation_text: One must study / need to study.

grammar_points.title: Imperative: informal singular (basic)
grammar_points.summary: Use simple imperatives for commands/requests (informal).

grammar_points.title: Imperative: polite/plural (-те)
grammar_points.summary: Use -те for polite/plural imperatives.

grammar_points.title: Negative imperative with не
grammar_points.summary: Negate imperatives with 'не'.

grammar_points.title: Любить + accusative
grammar_points.summary: Express likes/preferences with любить + accusative object.

grammar_points.title: Imperfective: process/habit (concept)
grammar_points.summary: Imperfective often describes process or habitual action (A1 awareness).

grammar_points.title: Perfective: completion/result (concept)
grammar_points.summary: Perfective often emphasizes completion/result (A1 awareness).

grammar_points.title: Идти (go on foot, one direction)
grammar_points.summary: Use идти for a single trip on foot (one direction).

examples.translation_text: He is going to the store.

grammar_points.title: Ехать (go by transport, one direction)
grammar_points.summary: Use ехать for a single trip by transport (one direction).

examples.translation_text: We are going to the park (by transport).

grammar_points.title: Ходить vs идти (habit vs one trip)
grammar_points.summary: Ходить = habitual/multi-direction; идти = one trip.

examples.example_text: Я хожу в школу каждый день.
examples.translation_text: I go to school every day.
Right now I'm going to school.
Do you often go to the park?

grammar_points.title: Ездить vs ехать (habit vs one trip)
grammar_points.summary: Ездить = habitual/multi-direction; ехать = one trip.

examples.example_text: Я езжу на работу каждый день.
examples.translation_text: I go to work every day (by transport).
Right now I'm going to work.

grammar_points.title: Motion verbs in past (basic)
grammar_points.summary: Use past forms to say where you went/came from (basic).
grammar_points.usage_notes: Irregular past of идти: шёл/шла; teach as a chunk.

examples.translation_text: Yesterday I went to the park (on foot).

grammar_points.title: в + prepositional (location: где?)
grammar_points.summary: Location in/at with 'в' + prepositional.

examples.translation_text: The book is in the bag.

grammar_points.title: на + prepositional (location: где?)
grammar_points.summary: Location on/at with 'на' + prepositional for many places/surfaces.

examples.translation_text: The phone is on the table.

grammar_points.title: в + accusative (destination: куда?)
grammar_points.summary: Destination to/into with 'в' + accusative.

examples.translation_text: We are going to the park.
She is going to the store.

grammar_points.title: на + accusative (destination: куда?)
grammar_points.summary: Destination to/onto (work/events) with 'на' + accusative.

examples.translation_text: We are going to a concert.
She is going to a lesson.

grammar_points.title: у + genitive (at someone's place / possession frame)
grammar_points.summary: Use 'у' + genitive for 'at someone's place' and for possession constructions.

grammar_points.title: из + genitive (origin from inside)
grammar_points.summary: Use 'из' + genitive for 'from' (inside origin).

grammar_points.title: с + genitive (origin from surface/event)
grammar_points.summary: Use 'с' + genitive for 'from' (surface/event origin).

examples.translation_text: Take the cup from the table.

grammar_points.title: по-русски / по-английски (fixed language adverbs)
grammar_points.summary: Use 'по-...' as fixed adverbs meaning 'in (a language)'.

grammar_points.title: Numbers 1–10 (core)
grammar_points.summary: Use 1–10 for simple quantities, age, and transactions.

grammar_points.title: Numbers 11–19 (-надцать)
grammar_points.summary: Recognize and use 11–19 for time, age, quantities.

grammar_points.title: Asking the time
grammar_points.summary: Ask what time it is with common phrases.

grammar_points.title: Time anchors: сегодня / вчера / завтра
grammar_points.summary: Use basic adverbs to anchor present/past/future statements.

grammar_points.title: И (and)
grammar_points.summary: Connect words and simple clauses with 'и'.

examples.translation_text: I am a student and an athlete.
He is at home, and she is at home.

grammar_points.title: Потому что (because)
grammar_points.summary: Give a simple reason with 'потому что'.

examples.example_text: Я не иду, потому что я занят.
examples.translation_text: I'm not going because I'm busy.

examples.example_text: Я люблю чай, потому что он вкусный.
examples.translation_text: I like tea because it's tasty.
We are at home because it's cold.

grammar_points.title: Поэтому (so/therefore)
grammar_points.summary: Express a result with 'поэтому'.

examples.example_text: Я занят, поэтому я не иду.
examples.translation_text: I'm busy, so I'm not going.
It's raining, so we are at home.

examples.example_text: У меня нет времени, поэтому потом.
examples.translation_text: I don't have time, so later.

grammar_points.title: Greetings (Привет / Здравствуйте / Доброе утро)
grammar_points.summary: Use basic greetings appropriate to context.

grammar_points.title: Goodbye (Пока / До свидания / До завтра)
grammar_points.summary: Use basic farewells appropriate to context.

grammar_points.title: Спасибо / Пожалуйста
grammar_points.summary: Спасибо = thanks; пожалуйста = you're welcome and also please.

grammar_points.title: Извините (excuse me / sorry)
grammar_points.summary: Use извините to apologize or get attention politely.

examples.translation_text: Excuse me, where is the метро?

grammar_points.title: Core repair phrases (не понимаю / повторите)
grammar_points.summary: Use a few phrases to repair communication.
